when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in formal contexts.
example: धन्यवाद, आपने मेरी मदद की। (dhanyavaad, aapne meri madad ki.) - Thank you for helping me.

when_to_say: Used to grab someone's attention before speaking.
example: सुनो, मुझे तुमसे बात करनी है। (suno, mujhe tumse baat karni hai.) - Listen, I need to talk to you.

when_to_say: Used to describe feelings of joy.
example: मैं बहुत खुश हूँ। (main bahut khush hoon.) - I am very happy.

when_to_say: Used to ask questions.
example: क्या तुमने खाना खाया? (kya tumne khana khaya?) - Did you eat food?

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of reading.
example: मुझे किताब पढ़ना पसंद है। (mujhe kitaab padhna pasand hai.) - I like to read books.

when_to_say: Used to compliment someone's appearance or something pleasant.
example: यह बगीचा बहुत सुंदर है। (yah bageecha bahut sundar hai.) - This garden is very beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend.
example: मेरा सबसे अच्छा दोस्त राम है। (mera sabse accha dost Ram hai.) - My best friend is Ram.

when_to_say: Used to express the need for water.
example: मुझे पानी चाहिए, मैं प्यासा हूँ। (mujhe pani chahiye, main pyasa hoon.) - I need water, I am thirsty.

when_to_say: Used to refer to meals or food in general.
example: मुझे खाना बहुत पसंद है। (mujhe khana bahut pasand hai.) - I love food.

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of speaking.
example: हिंदी बोलना आसान है। (hindi bolna aasan hai.) - Speaking Hindi is easy.

when_to_say: Used to express urgency.
example: जल्दी आओ, देर हो रही है। (jaldi aao, der ho rahi hai.) - Come quickly, it's getting late.

when_to_say: Used to describe size or importance.
example: यह कमरा बहुत बड़ा है। (yah kamra bahut bada hai.) - This room is very big.

when_to_say: Used to describe something of small size.
example: मेरा घर छोटा है। (mera ghar chhota hai.) - My house is small.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the sky.
example: आसमान नीला है। (aasman neela hai.) - The sky is blue.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water.
example: पानी पियो, सेहत के लिए अच्छा है। (pani piyo, sehat ke liye accha hai.) - Drink water, it's good for health.

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of walking.
example: चलो, बाजार चलते हैं। (chalo, bazar chalte hain.) - Let's go to the market.

when_to_say: Used to describe aspirations or dreams while sleeping.
example: मैंने एक सुंदर सपना देखा। (maine ek sundar sapna dekha.) - I had a beautiful dream.

when_to_say: Used to describe the process of gaining knowledge.
example: मुझे नई भाषाएँ सीखना पसंद है। (mujhe nai bhashayen seekhna pasand hai.) - I like learning new languages.

when_to_say: Used to affirm something with certainty.
example: तुम बिल्कुल सही हो। (tum bilkul sahi ho.) - You are absolutely correct.

when_to_say: Used to refer to tasks or job responsibilities.
example: मुझे अपना काम खत्म करना है। (mujhe apna kaam khatam karna hai.) - I need to finish my work.

when_to_say: Used to refer to sports or recreational activities.
example: हमें खेल खेलना पसंद है। (humein khel khelna pasand hai.) - We like to play games.

when_to_say: Used to talk about the early part of the day.
example: मैं सुबह जल्दी उठता हूँ। (main subah jaldi uthta hoon.) - I wake up early in the morning.

when_to_say: Used to describe units of language.
example: यह शब्द का सही अर्थ क्या है? (yah shabd ka sahi arth kya hai?) - What is the correct meaning of this word?

when_to_say: Used to describe academic learning.
example: पढ़ाई पर ध्यान देना जरूरी है। (padhai par dhyan dena zaruri hai.) - It is important to focus on studies.

when_to_say: Used to refer to comprehension or grasping ideas.
example: यह समझना मुश्किल है। (yah samajhna mushkil hai.) - This is difficult to understand.

when_to_say: Used to refer to something funny or humorous.
example: तुम्हारा मजाक बहुत अच्छा था। (tumhara mazaak bahut accha tha.) - Your joke was very funny.

when_to_say: Used to describe pleasant smells.
example: फूलों की खुशबू बहुत अच्छी है। (phoolon ki khushboo bahut acchi hai.) - The fragrance of flowers is very nice.

when_to_say: Used to refer to facts or honesty.
example: सच बोलना हमेशा अच्छा होता है। (sach bolna hamesha accha hota hai.) - Telling the truth is always good.

when_to_say: Used to describe simplicity or convenience.
example: यह काम आसानी से हो जाएगा। (yah kaam aasani se ho jayega.) - This task will be done easily.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed.
example: गाड़ी बहुत तेज चल रही है। (gaadi bahut tez chal rahi hai.) - The car is moving very fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is not fast.
example: मुझे धीमा संगीत पसंद है। (mujhe dheema sangeet pasand hai.) - I like slow music.

when_to_say: Used to describe a place of residence.
example: मेरा घर दिल्ली में है। (mera ghar dilli mein hai.) - My home is in Delhi.

when_to_say: Used to describe feelings of anger.
example: गुस्सा करना ठीक नहीं है। (gussa karna theek nahi hai.) - Getting angry is not good.

when_to_say: Used to compliment someone's appearance or demeanor.
example: यह बच्चा बहुत प्यारा है। (yah bachha bahut pyara hai.) - This child is very cute.

when_to_say: Used to describe location.
example: हम बाहर घूमने जा रहे हैं। (hum baahar ghoomne ja rahe hain.) - We are going outside for a walk.

when_to_say: Used to express affection or deep care.
example: मुझे अपने परिवार से बहुत प्यार है। (mujhe apne parivaar se bahut pyaar hai.) - I love my family very much.

when_to_say: Used when seeking information or clarification.
example: मेरा एक सवाल है। (mera ek sawaal hai.) - I have a question.

when_to_say: Used to describe the natural element around us.
example: यहां की हवा बहुत साफ है। (yahaan ki hawa bahut saaf hai.) - The air here is very clean.

when_to_say: Used to refer to windows in buildings or vehicles.
example: खिड़की खोलो, हवा अंदर आने दो। (khidki kholo, hawa andar aane do.) - Open the window, let the air in.

when_to_say: Used to refer to melodies or tunes.
example: मुझे शास्त्रीय संगीत सुनना पसंद है। (mujhe shastriya sangeet sunna pasand hai.) - I like listening to classical music.

when_to_say: Used to describe aspirations or night visions.
example: हर किसी को अपने सपने पूरे करने चाहिए। (har kisi ko apne sapne poore karne chahiye.) - Everyone should fulfill their dreams.

when_to_say: Used to describe low temperature or coldness.
example: मुझे ठंडा पानी चाहिए। (mujhe thanda pani chahiye.) - I need cold water.

when_to_say: Used to describe high temperature or warmth.
example: गर्मी के दिनों में ठंडा रहना चाहिए। (garmi ke dinon mein thanda rehna chahiye.) - One should stay cool in hot days.

when_to_say: Used to describe brightness or glow.
example: सूरज की चमक बहुत तेज है। (sooraj ki chamak bahut tez hai.) - The sun's shine is very bright.

when_to_say: Used to describe power or energy.
example: शारीरिक और मानसिक ताकत जरूरी है। (sharirik aur maansik taakat zaruri hai.) - Physical and mental strength are important.

when_to_say: Used to describe swiftness or agility.
example: गाड़ी की तेज़ी बहुत ज्यादा थी। (gaadi ki tezhi bahut zyada thi.) - The car's speed was very high.

when_to_say: Used to describe the state of rest.
example: मुझे गहरी नींद आ रही है। (mujhe gahri neend aa rahi hai.) - I am feeling very sleepy.

when_to_say: Used to describe climate or weather conditions.
example: आज का मौसम बहुत अच्छा है। (aaj ka mausam bahut accha hai.) - Today's weather is very nice.

when_to_say: Used to describe mental sharpness.
example: सही निर्णय के लिए बुद्धि का उपयोग करें। (sahi nirnay ke liye buddhi ka upyog karein.) - Use intelligence to make the right decision.

when_to_say: Used to refer to honesty or reality.
example: सच्चाई को कभी छुपाना नहीं चाहिए। (sachchai ko kabhi chhupana nahi chahiye.) - The truth should never be hidden.

when_to_say: Used to express expectations for positive outcomes.
example: हमें हमेशा अच्छी उम्मीद रखनी चाहिए। (humein hamesha acchi ummeed rakhni chahiye.) - We should always have good hopes.

when_to_say: Used to refer to understanding or learning.
example: ज्ञान सबसे बड़ी दौलत है। (gyaan sabse badi daulat hai.) - Knowledge is the greatest wealth.

when_to_say: Used to refer to opinions or ideas.
example: मेरा इस विषय पर अलग विचार है। (mera is vishay par alag vichar hai.) - I have a different thought on this topic.

when_to_say: Used to express joy or satisfaction.
example: आपकी सफलता से मुझे बहुत खुशी हुई। (aapki safalta se mujhe bahut khushi hui.) - I felt very happy with your success.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasks or situations that require effort.
example: हर चुनौती को स्वीकार करना चाहिए। (har chunauti ko sweekar karna chahiye.) - Every challenge should be accepted.

when_to_say: Used to describe learned lessons or skills from situations.
example: अनुभव से हमें बहुत कुछ सीखने को मिलता है। (anubhav se humein bahut kuch seekhne ko milta hai.) - We learn a lot from experience.

when_to_say: Used to describe attempts or actions to achieve something.
example: सफलता के लिए प्रयास करना जरूरी है। (safalta ke liye prayaas karna zaruri hai.) - Efforts are necessary for success.

when_to_say: Used to describe help or assistance.
example: मुझे आपके सपोर्ट की जरूरत है। (mujhe aapke support ki zarurat hai.) - I need your support.

when_to_say: Used to describe self-assurance or belief in oneself.
example: आत्मविश्वास से हर समस्या हल हो सकती है। (aatmavishwas se har samasya hal ho sakti hai.) - Confidence can solve any problem.

when_to_say: Used to describe a shift or transformation.
example: परिवर्तन जीवन का नियम है। (parivartan jeevan ka niyam hai.) - Change is the rule of life.

when_to_say: Used to describe motivation or encouragement.
example: आपकी बातों से मुझे प्रेरणा मिली। (aapki baaton se mujhe prerna mili.) - Your words inspired me.

when_to_say: Used to describe commitment or devotion.
example: काम के प्रति समर्पण सफलता लाता है। (kaam ke prati samarpan safalta lata hai.) - Dedication to work brings success.

when_to_say: Used to describe the ability to wait calmly.
example: धैर्य रखना सफलता की कुंजी है। (dhairya rakhna safalta ki kunji hai.) - Patience is the key to success.

when_to_say: Used to describe smart decision-making.
example: समझदारी से लिए गए फैसले बेहतर होते हैं। (samajhdari se liye gaye faisle behtar hote hain.) - Decisions made with wisdom are better.

when_to_say: Used to describe bravery or fearlessness.
example: साहस के बिना सफलता मुश्किल है। (sahas ke bina safalta mushkil hai.) - Success is difficult without courage.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a companion or close person.
example: मेरा सबसे अच्छा मित्र राहुल है। (mera sabse accha mitr Rahul hai.) - Rahul is my best friend.

when_to_say: Used to talk about physical or mental well-being.
example: स्वास्थ्य सबसे बड़ी संपत्ति है। (swasthya sabse badi sampatti hai.) - Health is the greatest wealth.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a staple food grain.
example: मैंने दो प्लेट चावल खाया। (maine do plate chaaval khaya.) - I ate two plates of rice.

when_to_say: Used to refer to expressing thoughts through words.
example: मुझे हिंदी बोलना आता है। (mujhe Hindi bolna aata hai.) - I can speak Hindi.

when_to_say: Used to talk about privileges or entitlements.
example: हर नागरिक के अपने अधिकार होते हैं। (har nagrik ke apne adhikaar hote hain.) - Every citizen has their own rights.

when_to_say: Used to describe the environment or natural world.
example: प्रकृति की रक्षा करना हमारी जिम्मेदारी है। (prakriti ki raksha karna hamari zimmedari hai.) - Protecting nature is our responsibility.

when_to_say: Used to describe acquiring knowledge or skills.
example: मुझे नई भाषा सीखना अच्छा लगता है। (mujhe nai bhaasha seekhna accha lagta hai.) - I enjoy learning new languages.

when_to_say: Used to describe a peaceful or quiet state.
example: पढ़ाई के लिए शांत माहौल जरूरी है। (padhai ke liye shaant maahaul zaroori hai.) - A calm environment is important for studying.

when_to_say: Used to describe traveling or trips.
example: हमने गोवा की यात्रा की। (hamne Goa ki yaatra ki.) - We went on a trip to Goa.

when_to_say: Used to describe sports or recreational activities.
example: मुझे क्रिकेट खेलना पसंद है। (mujhe cricket khelna pasand hai.) - I like playing cricket.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that enhances knowledge.
example: यह किताब बहुत ज्ञानवर्धक है। (yeh kitaab bahut gyaanvardhak hai.) - This book is very informative.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a difficult situation or obstacle.
example: समस्या का समाधान ढूंढना चाहिए। (samasya ka samadhan dhoondhna chahiye.) - A solution to the problem should be found.

when_to_say: Used to describe learning or schooling.
example: शिक्षा जीवन में सफलता के लिए महत्वपूर्ण है। (shiksha jeevan mein safalta ke liye mahatvapurn hai.) - Education is important for success in life.

when_to_say: Used to describe independence or liberty.
example: स्वतंत्रता हमारा मौलिक अधिकार है। (swatantrata hamara maulik adhikar hai.) - Freedom is our fundamental right.

when_to_say: Used to describe something amusing or entertaining.
example: यह कहानी बहुत मजेदार है। (yeh kahani bahut majedaar hai.) - This story is very funny.
